newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - April 1.
newsitem.headline: MALAYSIA STOCKS - factors to watch - April 1.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Malaysian stocks on Tuesday:
* In the U.S., the Dow Jones Industrial Average succumbed to one of its largest-ever point losses, falling 156 points to 6,584.

* The Kuala Lumpur Composite Index dropped 14.54 points, or 1.19 percent to 1,203.10. Malaysia's central bank, Bank Negara's annual report published last Friday spelt out restrictions on the financing of property and share acquisitions, to curb speculation, causing banking and property stocks to fall.

* Analysts said they expect the weakness to continue in Kuala Lumpur. "A rebound is possible today, but it would be short-lived, as people would be looking to cut their losses," said Ooi Soon Beng, research head at Inter-Pacific Securities.
* Fast-food retailer KFC Holdings announced a 50 percent jump in net profit for the year to December 31, 1996
* Timber company Aokam Perdana said it was in the final stages of negotiations to buy two timber concessions and sawmills from Idris Hydraulic.
* Petronas Gas signed an agreement to build a 300 million ringgit chemical storage facility in Terengganu state.
